Reviews.Content: Lower End Hotel With Good and Bad Points Midtown hotel is located less than two miles north of the Superdome on Tulane Ave in an area of town that has several vacant lots, several vacant and perhaps abandoned buildings, and a couple of very low rent bars. The hotel has a parking lot in the rear which was adequately lighted at night, but unguarded and lacking a security gate. The entrances to the hotel bypassing the lobby have been blocked by iron gates. The general premises were, while not immaculate, reasonably clean and orderly given the class of hotel. My assessment was that it was by far the nicest hotel in this area of town, there being 4 or five hotels between the Superdome and I-10 on Tulane Ave. The staff was very polite, courteous and helpful. They cheerfully and promptly provided an iron and an ironing board to my room on request. I was allowed to check in early at 9AM without a problem. My room rate was very reasonable for New Orleans at $72 including tax (in May of 2008). I requested a wakeup call for 5AM when checking in. I later noticed that my room had no phone (no problem since I had a cell phone), and when returning in the evening (the front desk seems to be staffed 24 hours), I verified that I could get a wake up call. I discovered that the clerk had forgotten to make note of my request. I did subsequently get a wake up knock on the door at 5AM, which was appreciated. I suggest you have your own alarm clock. I also suggest you do not let the desk clerk make a copy of your driver鈥檚 license when checking in, as this represents a potential identity theft problem especially if you are paying with a credit card. My room had clean sheets and linens, no unpleasant aromas, and dim lighting. The ceiling appeared to have some minor sagging due possibly to water damage. While the bathroom looked generally clean, there was a cigarette butt (staining the bowl water brown) and some empty sugar packets in the toilet. Three small soaps, shampoo envelopes, and two clean towels and wash clothes were provided. There were no face towels. No bath mat or drinking cup or facial tissues were provided (the latter being no problem as there were several extra rolls of toilet paper). I did not check to see if the well-used coffee maker worked. No coffee, cups, creamer, etc. were provided. What do you expect for $72?The hotel has a club on the first floor which was very lively at 11PM when I got back to the hotel, although I did not check out the club. Despite the club noise, my room overlooking the clean courtyard pool was very quiet. Two men seemed to be having an argument in front of my door about 1:30 AM, but I turned on the TV and went back to sleep. If you are used to staying in the Radisson, then Midtown Hotel New Orleans is probably not for you. If you are looking for an OK inexpensive hotel and you can tolerate one that is not in the nicest neighborhood, then you probably will like Midtown. I would probably stay there again.
Reviews.Author: lepanto_lee

Reviews.Content: Midtown Hotel is a NO NO This place is what is called a seedy motel. I do not classify it as a hotel because people can enter from off the street without using the front doors. There are steps on both ends without the benefit of doors, that lead to the street. Drug addicts and ladies of the night frequent this establishment I was told.I read the review before booking but because the two most recent spoke of new management I make reservations to stay there. The female owner was very pleasant over the phone and I was under the impression I would have a nice stay...not.Upon arrival to New Orleans I was in a hurry to get to my destination so I sent my male friend who picked me up from the airport to check me in and drop off my luggage after he took me to my immediate destination. I did not speak with him prior to being dropped off later that evening.From the moment I stepped out the car I knew this was not going to be a good experience. There were two person hanging outside the facility that had the appearance of being homeless. There was debris around the grounds. Upon opening the door the smell was very musty, the title was filthy and the carpet was stained. I was greeted by the most pleasant person. She IS THE ONLY THING GOOD ABOUT THIS HOTEL. She greeted me by my name and told me she had given me her best suite. She escorted me to my room. The elevator was slow and appeared to have not been cleaned in a few months. When we arrived at my room, I was in total shock! This is the best...Lord I never want to see the worst. The musty odor was very dominate in the room, the carpet was stained galore and the tile needed to be mopped twenty times or more. Here I was in New Orleans without transportation, in need of rest and in a filthy hotel. I wanted to take a shower, so I took one of the two towels and placed in tub and took a shower, I dried off with the other and then used it to step on and then immediately put on my shoes. I pulled back the bedspread and found it to be stained as well. I had a blanket from my flight so I used it to laid down to sleep. But I couldn't sleep because of the noise in the hall, off the street and on the floor above me. But I also couldn't sleep because the bed was hurting my back and reeked of urine. I could not wait until morning to get the heck out of there. My ride was to pick me up at 10:30, when he arrived I was there with all my luggage ready to go. Since I had paid for three night, I needed a credit placed back on my credit card. The female owner was very apologetic and called for her husband to issue my credit. He was apprehensive and said that he could reimburse me because the man had paid for my room. I assured him I had paid for the room, the man had just brought my things over from the airport per my request. Then he wanted to charge me a $10 per night cancellation fee. He didn't and I am glad because I didn't want to have to go there with him.My male friend tells me, he know this place was unsavory when he got there, even the man owner caution him about not letting the lady (me I guess) take him for his money. What does that sound like to you.I hate giving this review because the Mrs is so sweet, but I would not want another person especially woman to book this place from their hometown and wind up going through anything like what I did. I was so tired I just didn't have the strength to pack up and call a cab that night to go eslewhere.Other noteworthy particulars are, the TV was a 15 inch, the room had no telephone in the room and the room had a window to the hallway. Nice features were a refrigerator and a microwave and both were clean.I ended up going to the Okeefe Plaza Hotel which was very nice for the exact rate, the only difference they were not as friendly or nice.
Reviews.Author: SleeplessInNawlins

Reviews.Content: Loved the room I stayed in the best room. Also the staff was amazing they knew everything about where to go and what to see. Also the New Owners live there and if there is a problem it is fixed right away. Thank you Midtown Hotel
Reviews.Author: momof3Vermont

Reviews.Content: i loved it your info is wrong but i found the place anyway. it seems a different hotel took over their sites without them knowing. But I came across it any way. the owners took this lovely hotel after the storm and are making it a great place. you all need to go there and stay during your trip to new orleans.their real number is [--] and their fax is [--].
Reviews.Author: nolahotel

Reviews.Content: Not the worst, but not the best When we first arrived at this hotel, I was sure that it was horrible. But it really wasn't that bad. Here is a list of things I noticed:1) The shuttle that is advertised as a running downtown or to the French Quarter, only runs from 7am to 12pm, then from 5pm to 9pm. Therefore, if you want to go down there in the afternoon, you have to take a cab, which costs around $12. 2) The parking area for guests is in the back of the hotel and they lock it at 10pm. The upside to this is that there is a bar in the hotel, and they are generally open until 11pm.3) The resturant in the place wasn't too bad. The best part of it was the friendly service we received.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Aaaaaaaaaagggggghhhh! I was going to write a decent review because you can't really expect much more for the price and they are presently undergoing renovations. But they really peed me off with the automatic incidental charge and then had the nerve to say that it was a New Orleans policy. I stayed at the Sheraton after leaving this place and I incurred no additional charges. P.S. Don't eat at the restaurant.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Horrible Experience ! ! ! The only thing good about this place was Miss Lucy behind the counter. Trust me, she was the ONLY thing. From the time we walked in the smell was musty and it reeked of mold. The carpet and walls were stained and the owners of the property were atrocious. My sister, who has asthma, could not stay at this hotel. When we complained and asked for help to relocate, they refused and threathened to call the police. Their website is completely misleading. STAY AWAY from this place ! I only wish that Miss Lucy worked someplace else.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Worst room experience Where to begin? Front desk help was unhelpful. Room was filthy and carpet was so dirty that after showering, I put my socks on so my feet would not touch the floor. Socks were black on bottom from filth. Walls in bath area dirty. Room not supplied. (Had to go to front desk for cups, soap, coffee, etc.) Both nights, of a two-night stay, noise began about 12:30 a.m. with constant (I mean constant) foot traffic back and forth across room floor above us. Floor joists squeaked all night and we got virtually no sleep. (Squeek, squeek, squeek) I inquired at the front desk the next a.m. if there was another guest room above us or a gym and told the desk clerk about the noise. Again, no concern what-so-ever. We paid $150 per night for this experience. Never again. Take your money and stay somewhere else!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Quality Questionable May,2004,Junior High Prom,rap music blaring,kids,kids,kids,get the picture.Outside the hotel was scary, the parking lot very scary. Rooms were clean, beds good, small bathrooms. Noise from prom ceased after 11pm. Don't do breakfast in the restaurant, comedy sitcom material. Tulane University should sue them for using their name.This place is ok for sleeping,but run to your room,and lock the doors.
Reviews.Author: Miser

Reviews.Content: A tired hotel - look elsewhere As others have written, this hotel looks OK from the outside, but the rooms leave a lot to be desired. It's located in a not-too-good-looking neighborhood, and there isn't much around it in walking distance (restuarants, etc.). Rooms are dark, some don't even have windows. I'm fairly easy to please when it comes to hotels, especially if the price is reasonable. When I checked in, the surly and disinterested desk clerk first gave me a room which had not been cleaned. Then, when I went back to the desk to get another room, he booked me into and gave me a key for another room, which WAS ALREADY OCCUPIED! The person in the room was not too happy when I opened the door on him. The final room was musty smelling, with a badly chipped tub and mold in the tub and on the bathroom floor. I didn't have enough energy at that point to request another room.The location is fairly close to the City Park, so if you are headed to JazzFest it might not be a bad location. They do have a shuttle service to the French Quarter, which is pretty far away (10 minute drive). I didn't need the shuttle, but I imagine it's handy. But, I think it stops running around 10:00 p.m., just when many people are getting to the Quarter. It's also pretty far from the airport (10-15 minutes, with no shuttle).In short, if you have a car, stay elsewhere. I passed several Motel 6s which I wished I had booked instead.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: That run down feeling I should have read the reviews on this place before booking it. The exterior of this hotel looks good and kind of quaint but the inside is badly in need of repair. Everything is old here. It needs new paint, new carpet, the wallpaper is peeling off of the walls and is damaged in many spots in the rooms and the hotel lobby, and the tub was clogged. It is not a good value and I certainly would never stay here again. It was depressing to stay here.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Shuttle Van service was very convenient This hotel is older, but the fact that it is only a couple miles from the Fairgrounds Horse Race Track, and that it also has a shuttle van that goes to the French Quarter was what sold us on this hotel. All of the staff we encountered were very nice and helpful too. We will stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: too far from french quarter Let me just say ...... it smelled bad,the shuttle driver was creepy,the hotel was old and run down,the beds were wore out,the hotel was in a BAd PART OF TOWN,But let me also say NEW ORLEANS itself is AWESOME!We will stay at a different hotel next time!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: OK, but a little rundown We stayed there Feb 7th-9th and found it to be a little rundown. Luckily we didn't pay to much for the room. The location was great close to everything and very close to the Garden District. If I had my choice I'd stay somewhere else next time.
Reviews.Author: crzyfrog777

Reviews.Content: nola We had a good time-rode the shuttle to Bourbon St the place is old, the rooms are clean,the hot tub is very hot(of course the pool was very cold)Security walked us to our car after dark.Nice place for the $
Reviews.Author: waderlust

Reviews.Content: Quaint I have visited this quaint hotel many times. In fact,evertime I visit New Orleans. The rooms are old but have that antebellum feel. The restaraunt is divine, try the french toast for breakfast-you will not be disappointed.The shuttle is a terrific way to see the city-the drop off points are accessable and easy to get to. The staff is friendly and the jacuzzi is a nice way to unwind after a day on Bourbon Street. I will be going to my favorite hotel in 6 weeks and I look forward to it.And as always, the feel of the city is right in your room.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great value for price We stayed there three nights and had a wonderful time. The shuttle was convient. There is bar and restuarant at the hotel. The staff was more than helful with any detail we needed for our trip.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Dirty hotel This hotel is dirty. It looks nice from the outside but it isn't. The air conditioner didn't work in our room. The carpet was stained, wallpaper was peeling off the walls, the remote did not work, and it isn't in a good part of town. We had also requested a non-smoking room, which we did not receive. It is not as close to downtown as it says, definetly not within walking distance, nor would it be a safe area to walk in. I would never stay here again. We even came back a night early rather than spend another night in this hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
